intro: Hieracium pseudocirritum subsp. permirum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and stems that produce a single inflorescence of yellow flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The flowers bloom from June to August, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
